onset.Description: Onset (in seconds) of the event from the beginning of the first datapoint. Negative onsets account for events before the first stored data point.

Description.Description: Duration of the sentence in seconds from onset.

sample.Description: The event onset time in number of sampling points.First sample is 0.

value.Description: The event code (also known as trigger code or event ID) associated with the event.

Description.Description: Provides some details about the current sentence presented. In the Oldenburg Sentence Test (OLSA), sentences are organized into multiple lists, each containing 20 sentences.
Relative path of clean speech audio file corresponding to the sentence heard by the participant. Clean audio files may not be provided.
Speech intelligibility of the presented sentences was defined and computed based on the corresponding SNR values using individual psychometric functions.
Signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) of the presented sentence

StimulusPresentation.rrid: Matlab: n/a  / SoundMexPro: n/a / pypixxlib: n/a
